Name: Farm Cards
Description:
Farm Cards is a fast-paced game where players assume the roles of farmers, try to harvest the most balanced crops they can, and earn the most money at the Farmer’s Market. Each player is in direct competition with the others and tries to sabotage the others’ fields by dumping garbage on their land! Don’t expect a fellow farmer to be kind, his only goal is to win!

This is a print and play game. There are 108 custom cards depicting plots of land with seeds and values; and seeds with values. The game may also be played with 2 standard 52 card decks + 4 jokers.

Players take turns working with the "junked-up land" passed to them by their competitors and attempt to achieve the highest score through two mechanics.
1- A standard point mechanic through plot and seed values (card face-value).
2- A second scale representing pH balance that can either be positive, negative, or balanced (0). This is achieved through the use of card suits (vegetables, fruits, and grains with the custom cards - 8 in total; Spades, Hearts, Clubs, and Diamonds with standard American playing cards - 4 in total).

The game is currently undergoing playtesting and review.

Name: CrossRoads at Darklion Pass
Description:
CrossRoads is a competitive RPG board game. The game can be played with a light conquest approach or a very strategic competition between players. Repeatable play is very enjoyable and different each time.

Game Play: Each player will play with a hand of cards with each card having three potential uses during the game. Managing your cards requires strategy, planning, resource consideration, sacrifice, and making the right card selection to replenish your hand.

Players can choose to discard their cards to travel the game board and earn experience. They can use their cards to put together combination attacks against creatures in a quest to earn experience. The third option is to use cards to heal themselves when life gets too low. The game play is dynamic and competitive with other player disrupting plans and having plans of their own. You will need to manage your cards and maneuver your opponents to win the game.

Goal: The goal of each player is the have the highest experience total at the end of the game. Experience is earned by using cards to either travel over the players color on the game board or by using them to damage a creature within a quest.

Box: Wealth beyond belief is promised to the bravest and most acclaimed adventurer who can purge Dark Lion Pass of its frightful dwellers. However, everyone knows that the pass cannot be cleared by a lone adventurer.

You join a group of adventurers that agree to work together to clear the menace from Dark Lion Pass and share the treasures and glory that come from accomplishing such a grand feat. The agreement is a loose alliance… each adventurer seems to be attempting to steal the glory and hoard the best treasures.
Are they attempting to be the bravest adventurer and keep all of the reward for themselves?

During the adventure you will try to gain as much glory as you can by stealing the treasure and doing the most damage to the creatures that lurk in the passes. You may also manipulate the path that your party takes to enhance your glory even further in Crossroads at Dark Lion Pass.

Can you manage all of this with the limited resources at your disposal? Only time and an adventure of a lifetime will tell. Welcome to Crossroads at Dark Lion Pass!

Name: Sgt. Preston Gets His Man
Description:
From eBay listing (Michelle Murray, used with permission):

This is a cardboard board game cut off of a cereal box. It's called "Sgt. Preston Gets His Man" and comes with the playing field, a spinner, 4 little pawns and instructions. To make the spinner work, you would put a straight pin through the center and twirl it--there should be a tiny cardboard pointer but that part is missing [in the photos]. The cardboard playing board is about 6" x 6", the spinner is 1 3/4" across, and each little pawn is 1/2" x 1/2". There is no date but it's probably 1950s.

Name: ゴジラ対地球防衛軍 (Godzilla vs. Earth Defense Force)
Description:
It is card game of the Godzilla movie. 
The player defends place card allocated as a commander of the earth defense force. 
The player drops out when all place cards are destroyed. The player that remains to the last minute wins.

Turn sequence:
1.Draw cards
2.Play cards
3.Attack evil monsters

Component:
100 cards
1 rule

Name: Pour l'amour d'une reine
Description:
A mini-game from the oldschool French magazine Casus Belli (Issue 18 - Dec 1983). In the game, adventurers must seduce the Queen of the Kingdom of Passion and eliminate all others courtiers while controlling military patrols. The game is a mix between roleplaying games and boardgame as each player defines the seduction and discretion score for his character. Several magic items may be found to help him in his mission.
The game can be played by 2 to 4 players.
The game has only 10 counters : 4 characters and 6 patrols.
It needs 2 d6 dices to play.
The games ends when a character has managed to sit on the throne besides the queen and all other players are captured, or it ends when all the characters are captured and remain in the depths of the dungeon.

Name: No More Room In Hell
Description:
Stand alone miniatures rules set for survival modern horror gaming. 28mm scale (though can really be used for any scale).  Book contains several scenarios providing different challenges for  the zombie survival genre.

From the back of the book:

No More Room In Hell - Surviving the Zombie Apocalypse allows you to create a group of characters amidst the end of the living world...and the start of the living-dead world.  Who will survive?  Who will feed the Zeds?  It's up to you to select the skills, the traits and the gear that you think that your survivors will need to face the rising zombie tide.

Featuring a campaign system, stand-alone games, random scenario, and quick-play random character generation, anything goes.  You'll need to fight the dead and the living as you struggle to gather enough food, ammunition and food for your band.

Name: Starship Marine
Description:
Starship Marines is an Starcraft boarding game done by Jim Wallman for minimum two players, with no limit in players. The game itself is a print and play type, and available for free download.

From the Introduction in the basic rules:
Starship Marine is a set of science fiction wargame rules, designed for use with toy soldiers. The basic idea is that there is a battle to control and capture a starship by a boarding party moving down the corridors and rooms of the ship. One side controls the attackers, who are mostly composed of the eponymous 'Starship Marines', and the defenders, usually less well armed crewmen, with perhaps a smattering of Marines to stiffen the defense. The deck plans can either be drawn out or built in 3D, depending on your preferences and time available. The scale of toy soldier is 25mm or 1/72, and any make of figures can be used [...]

The minimum you need are a few toy soldiers, some dice, a large sheet of paper with a deck plan on it, and the rules. A typical small game takes about a hour or so (longer if you like arguing about rules). The largest game we know of, to date, involved some 60 people, hundreds of toy soldiers, and many very very big sheets of paper.[...]

Name: Rex  Nemorensis
Description: This print and play game lets the players compete through chip investments in the forms of plants and animals.  The eventual winner is the one with the most points in chips at the end of the twelfth round or the one who amasses 20 or more chips and has a human in play at the end of a round.  A player must be aware at all times of what his opponents are doing, what cards are in play, how many plants/prey are available and who will be first or last in the turns to come.  The gods are fickle and hunting is always uncertain at best, so to be smiled upon by the die of fate is a must.

Name: Campin' Out
Description:
Players roll a die to move their piece along the track and answer questions about the Michigan State Park System and nature. The first player to reach the campfire wins.

The game is made of recycled materials and labels are supplied to stick onto bottle tops to create player tokens.

(User Summary)

Name: Critical Hit! Issue 4
Description:
Fourth biannual issue of "The Independent Journal of the ASL Hobby"

From the table of contents:
Armored Assault Tactics by Capt. Robert Modarelii III
Rangers Lead the Way by Steven C. Swann
Interview with Brian Martuzas
Stagnation and Innovation by Kurt Martin
Ernie Pyle: The Battle of San Pietro by Ray Tapio
ASL Action in the U.K. and the Midwest by Pete Phillips and Burnie Hegdahl
Roasting Chestnuts by Ted Blek and Alan Freedman

Scenarios:
CH41 Test of Nerves
CH42 Teryaeva Sloboda
CH43 Opening Blow
CH44 Operation Norwind
CH45 Curtain Call
CH46 Zerf Stranglehold
CH47 Steel and Irony
CH48 Double or Nothing!
CH49 High Danger
CH50 Simmons' Rebuff

Name: mIZÉria
Description: You create funny sentences using randomly drawn cards in this game. The box contains 1500 words on 250 word cards (also a die, player figures, sheets for notes) and the rulebook provides 4 different modes on how you can play the game. If you play it four-play it can be played as a partnership game as well. It's a game of fun but you also have to use your brain to make your partner or the other players find out the words. But be careful as you can use only three words!

Name: Megasztár Karaoke
Description:
Based on and bearing the name of the popular Hungarian television show (Megasztár, meaning "Mega-star", this is a board game with a karaoke dvd included. Each player or team sings one of the songs, then the other players or teams must vote which one they liked most, the second and third most (they get 3, 2 and 1 points respectively). You also get points if your presentation was voted the most creative, most humorous or you had the best voice. The scoring track has some special fields that can make you advance or step back; also some "camera" fields where you have to give an interview as a star and the other players are going to vote how much they liked the interview.
(user description)

Name: Wittstock 1636
Description:
From the Introduction

"From the fourth of our attempts to hammer DBR into an historical mould we reach forward to 1636, to the height of the Thirty Years War. Gustav Adolph has been in his grave for four years and the Swedish aura of invincibility has been shattered at Nordigen in 1634. Nevertheless, the Swedes are nothing if not resilient and under one of Gustav's outstanding lieutenants, Johann Baner, they have reconstituted their army and gone back on the offensive.

"John George, Elector of Saxony, has changed sides once again and now marches with the Imperial forces of Melchior Hatzfelt. With a combined army of 20,000 men the two outnumber the Swedes, and Baner has fallen back.

"Having seemingly disposed of the Swedish threat the Imperials have slackened their pursuit. Whereupon Baner has immediately turned on them, cutting off the joint army from the remaining Imperial troops in the neighborhood, and preparing to attack them near the small town of Wittstock on the river Dosse.

User Summary

Scenario comes with deployment information, army lists, orders of battle, etc.

Scenario appears in Wargames Illustrated #186 (March 2003)

Name: Hyperchess4
Description:
This 4-dimensional chess variant, using the standard 16 chesspieces and pawns, is played on a 4x4x4x4 board. (A printable 2D version of the board is provided, with coordinate numbers in each square.) This printable gameboard is laid out as a 4x4 arrangement of 16 "levels", each level being a 4x4 2D chessboard. Alternatively, 4 3D 4x4x4 gameboards set up in a row are usable. The game is available on Zillions, in a version by L Lynn Smith.

Piece moves are translated as directly as possible from 2D to 4D, with some adaptations for play balance. So a rook now can move not only north-south and east-west, but up-down and side to side, too, for a maximum of 8 possible directions. Bishops move diagonally within each level, and may also move diagonally from level to level, which simplifies the move somewhat, changing the bishop from a fully 4D piece to one that is 2D+2D. This change makes the game much easier to play.

The knight, on the other hand, rivals the queen in power, because it is the only piece in chess that already moves in 2 dimensions. On a 4x4x4x4 board, it can reach up to 2 dozen spots. The queen combines the moves of rook and bishop, and the king is a one-square queen in movement.

Pawns are the most changed, moving 1 square "forward" or "sideways" - 6 locations in all, and capturing as it moves. This allows 2 pawns to support each other, a useful feature on 
a 4D board.

The game is won by checkmate, which with the held king rule, can be achieved in the standard fashion, or it can be forced on a bare king by a king and 2 major pieces, from any legal positions on the board. The held king rule allows a king moving onto the other king's current "level" to pin the enemy king in that level. This solves a major problem in higher dimensional chess, that of mating the opponent on a 4D board, which has so many ways to escape.

Name: Greek Fire and Roman Fury
Description:
From the Introduction

"One of the regular debates that my wargaming colleagues and I seem to have is that of the role assumed by players during a wargame, and hence the level of detail that should be represented. Are we playing ships captains or fleet admirals? In general naval wargamers tend to assume the role of admirals whilst demanding a level of detail more appropriate to a 'game of captains.' For most periods this isn't too much of a problem as the numbers of ships tends to be relatively small, and there are fleet level rules with appropriate levels of abstraction for most periods. However, ancient naval warfare seems to be one period where all available rules operate at the ship level. Obviously this makes battles such as Salamis, with hundreds of ships involved, difficult to handle. I wanted a set of rules that could be used to recreate these enormous battles whilst placing the placing the players truly in the roles of admirals and squadron commanders. At this level the fate of the individual ships, other than those on which the commanders themselves are embarked, is unimportant. Hence, "Greek Fire and Roman Fury" was born.

"The basis for these rules is a theory that the naval battles of antiquity were fought in a style that was essentially similar to typical land actions. Therefore, in these rules, the respective fleets are represented by squadrons rather than individual ships, which are maneuvered around the 'battlefield' in a similar manner to armies. After a few false starts I decided to use the ever popular and quite robust American Civil War Fire and Fury as the basis for the system, hence the name I finally selected for this article."

User Summary

This miniatures rules set comes with information on what sorts of figures to use, and explains fleet composition, ship data (for the various sorts of ships that appear in the game), formations, sequence of play, morale, and a small number of charts

Rules set appears in Wargames Illustrated #187 (April 2003)

Name: Flaming at the Dog's Head
Description:
From the Introduction

"Once Hannibal had been defeated at Zama in 202 BC, Rome was clear to concentrate on securing and expanding its eastern frontier beyond the Adriatic. The resources required for the Second Punic War had previously forced the Romans to conclude a compromise with peace with Philip V of Macedon, but with the Carthaginian threat removed, it was payback time.

"The neutral states of Rhodes and Pergamum provided an excuse for war, appealing to Rome for aid against Macedonian aggression, and the legions marched  towards Greece. Philip blocked the passes onto the peninsula at Epirus, but a consul named Titus Quincticus Flaminius managed to get a small force around the Macedonian flank. Philip, convinced that the whole Roman army was about to descend upon him, pulled back into Thessaly.

"The Romans consolidated their hold on Epirus and voted Flaminius in for another term as consul and therefore military leader. After some intense diplomacy to establish which of the less dominant, minor powers of the region were allied to whom, Flaminius and Philip met at Cynoscephalae, named from the Greek for 'dog's head' after the name of a nearby ridge.

User Summary

Subtitled The Battle of Cynoscephalae 197 BC, this is a scenario for the Vis Bellica miniature wargame system. Scenario includes orders of battle for both sides, features of the battlefield, historical information about the battle, army sheeets for all of the forces, initial deployment, and defeat condition.

Scenario appears in Wargames Illustrated #187 (April 2003)

Name: Majorities
Description:
Majorities is a game with exceptionally simple rules, reminiscent of Stonehenge. Many variants (including a very natural 3-dimensional version) are possible.

It is based on the fact that in politics, or committees with sub-committees, a minority of people in critical places may nonetheless  carry a voting motion. This has long been felt as a weird situation by the game inventor (Bill Taylor), who has devised this family of games to illustrate this phenomenon.

Rules

The board is initially empty. The first player places a stone on any cell, then players take turns placing two pieces per turn on empty cells.

A majority of stones in a line wins that line.
A majority of parallel lines in a direction wins that direction.
A majority of directions wins the game.

The board has a few unplayable cells, to guarantee that every line has an odd number of playable cells, so that ties are impossible at all levels.

Source: Gamerz.net help file by Bill Taylor

Online Play

     Boardspace.net Real time or turn based,against humans or robot players
     Gamerz.net Turn-based


Mobile Apps

     Boardspace.net local multiplayer or online, IOS
     Boardspace.net local multiplayer or online, Android

Name: Line of Site
Description:
You and your opponent are snipers trying to kill off the members of your opponents army and maybe their sniper.

The Sniper and Hiding places cards form the Sniper Row. The rest make the Trench. On your turn, you take the aiming card and put it on the opponent's card that you're attacking. Roll a d6 to see if you hit. After that it's your opponent's turn and play proceeds until either one's army is terminated or a sniper is fallen.

There are 1 or 2 dice and 54 special cards in the game.
There is 1 Aiming Card and a Pass Card
There's a 26 cards set for each player's army. 
Each Army will consist of
1 Sniper (You)
9 Hiding places
1 General
1 Colonel
1 Major
1 Captain
2 Sargent
10 Solders

Name: Small World: Necromancer Island
Description:
Publisher blurb:

A Small World Scenario for 3 to 6 players

At first no one noticed the small island on the lake - nor paid any attention to the gnarly pretense of a man who drifted onto it, sitting astride a wooden log with a huge grimoire on his lap employing a shovel as his unlikely paddle. A ghastly green mist soon shrouded the island, wrapping it in a ghostly silence pierced only by a maniacal laughter and some intermittent curses. Then, one moonlit night, an impossibly crooked tower emerged high above the mist, casting a long and dark shadow on the surrounding land... The Necromancer had arrived!

In Necromancer Island, one of the players assumes the role of a dreaded Necromancer who inhabits an island in the center of Small World's central Lake region. He captures the souls of all Race tokens lost to conquests, using them to progressively spawn Ghosts who invade the surrounding Regions. To make matters worse, his Powers grow as his reach across the land increases. If the Necromancer succeeds in bringing all of his Ghosts into play, anytime before the game's end, he wins!

Name: Teikoku
Description:
A PnP game set in the fictional world of the Chrysanthemum Empire. Players control Houses to ultimately control the empire within the time of the Changing Winds, which lasts for 2 years. Any means is possible, be it by showing off your House's wealth, military might or even influence in the courts. Treachery is of course, the bread and butter among the Houses of the Chrysanthemum Empire.

A role selection and worker placement game for 2-6 players, inspired by Citadels and Stone Age, this game thrives to give the most gaming experience possible while expending as few resources as possible in making it.

Multiple six-sided dice are required.

6 pieces of A4 paper are required to build this game, mounting onto chip boards and some kind of thin cardboard for the counters are recommended. 9 playing cards with the size 2.5" x 3.5" and sleeves are also recommended.

Name: Back to the Future: The Card Game – Pizza Hydrator
Description:
(from the Publisher site)
This is an Item that you can add to your Back To The Future Card Game deck.

It says, "If you had this on the table during your previous turn, you may discard it instead of playing a card, to draw 5 cards."

This card was published in 2010 to promote the release of Back To The Future: The Card Game. It is a card that peels off a postcard. The front of the card is shiny, due to the peel-off method, but this will not affect gameplay, since the cardback matches the regular game.

Name: Monopoly: Coca-Cola 125th Anniversary Collector's Edition
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

Refresh yourself with this special COCA-COLA 125th Anniversary Collector's Edition of the MONOPOLY game. COCA-COLA’s most treasured collectibles over the past 125 years are all up for grabs as players buy, sell and trade posters, calendars, serving trays and more. Six collectible tokens including the Bell Glass, Diamond Can, Vintage Cooler, Delivery Truck, Polar Bear and Contour Bottle make this game a treasured keepsake for COCA-COLA fans of all ages.
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: Trivial Pursuit: The Rolling Stones Collector's Edition
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

It’s Only Rock ‘n Roll - but you’ll like it in this Rolling Stones Collector’s Edition of TRIVIAL PURSUIT. For the first time ever, one of the most legendary rock ‘n roll bands teams up with America’s favorite trivia game so fans can get some satisfaction by showing off all they know about The Rolling Stones. With over 2,000 questions from six categories covering the band’s history, music, accomplishments and more, there’s enough trivia for fans of all levels. So get your friends and neighbors together for a game you’ll want to play ‘til the whip comes down! Game includes custom die and playing pieces featuring the iconic Licks logo.

As in other Trivial Pursuit games, players roll dice to move around the board and answer trivia questions in various categories.  Players earn pieces by answering correctly on certain spaces for each category, and the winner is the first to collect one of every piece and return to the middle and answer one final question.

Name: Imperia 13: The Card Game
Description:
The Evil Empire has conquered their archenemies, but the fragile Pax Imperia is already breaking: absolute power is corrupting and another war has broken out. Now it's up to you to battle against former allies and end the civil war... before the Empire is destroyed from within!

Both players start with the same 100 item cards beforehand, but can only choose 70 of these to actually battle with. No single card is better than another. It's simply a matter of choosing your strategy: do you want more offense or defense? Will you go for a quick coup d'etat to seize power or try wearing down your oponent slowly instead?

Choose items that will help you end the civil war and restore peace the quickest. The fate of the empire rests on YOU!

Name: HiveQueen
Description: This is a chess-related abstract strategy game with an insect theme, played on a hex board of 61 cells. Pieces are the Queen, Highborn, Drone, Nurse, Worker, and Soldier. Each type of piece has a unique ability and movement. Soldiers are the only pieces that can capture, but they may only move over friendly pieces to do so. Nurses can "birth" new pieces, if there are enough workers available to support those pieces. The queen is the royal piece, and there can only be one per hive, but a highborn can promote to a queen, with the help of a drone, preventing defeat. Drones are also the only pieces with totally free movement, being able to fly to any open cell, but are limited to 2 per game. The game is won when your opponent does not have a queen on the board at the end of the opponent's movement/promotion phase.

Name: Manara Hard Game
Description:
A deck of cards, with an erotic theme, with an associated game. It has no resemblance to Manara Game but is more like a two player-in-a-group Dixit with sexually explicit art.
All players should ready a scoring pad were all the names of the players of their opposing gender are noted down. This is a boys vs girls game! The cards have 5 different backsides and are sorted in 5 piles. The active player picks a color and draws 2 cards. The opposing player also picks 2 from the same pile. The active player picks a card from the two (s)he drew. Sitting across from each other, both players make eye contact and, without speaking or gesturing, try to communicate the card the active player picked. Afters some time, both play their card. If it matches, both get 5 points. If not, they get a second chance, and if it matches now, they can earn 2 points. If it fails again, they receive 0 points. After every person has played with every other person of the opposite gender, the game ends. Points are added up, Winner (per gender!) who has the most. The "Winning couple" is entitled to act out one of there cards that gave them 5 points if the play group decides to vote for it.

Name: Murray River
Description:
"Murray River" is a tactical level wargame, for two players, of the battle that took place near the Murray River, Western Australia (WA), in October 1834. Governor Stirling led a British Force comprising troopers and soldiers of the 21st Regiment on a punitive expedition against a local Aboriginal community in an attempt to stem the rising tide of attacks by Natives that resided near the Murray River, against the white settlers in the region. Players control the various British and Native forces which took part in this battle. 
Units range from individuals to small groups. Map scale is 33 metres per hex and each turns represents about 4 minutes. Murray River comes with a full colour map in 2 A3 sections, 256 mounted color counters, rule book and charts in a ziplock bag.

Name: All Time Favorites
Description:
The All-Time Favorites Scenarios are reprints with updates and errata included and are the perfect size for a round. All-Time Favorites provide scenario choices for all of the time frames and theaters of WW2, as well as not requiring the player to own Heat of Battle campaign games or packs to play.

The ATF Scenario Cards are in a new full-color online format.
 There are three scenarios in the first installment of ATF:
1) Paper Line (from Recon by Fire #1), Germans panzers crash into the Dyle Line in Belgium, 1940.
 2) One Eye to the West (from Waffen SS:  No Quarter No Glory!), Late war SS trying to hold off the Russian onslaught in Vienna, 1945.

3) Bear Hunt (from the same pack). SS and Russians clash near Cherkasssy in 1943.

Name: Memoir '44: Winter Wars
Description:
As would befit your ration pack if you were about to embark on one of the coldest and most bitter fights of the war, after 5 long years of weary battles, we have packed this expansion with every thing you could ever need to combat in a snow-covered environment.

But judge for yourself, soldier! Inside this pack you will find:
- 88 double-sided Winter tiles, 28 Special Unit badges, 20 round markers and 16 obstacles
- 20 Winter Combat cards, similar in concept to the Urban Combat cards introduced in Memoir '44: Sword of Stalingrad
- 80 new Command cards, designed specifically for Breakthrough battles
- New Winter Combat rules
- New Troops, including the all new Tank Destroyer and Heavy Anti-Tank Gun units and Late War model versions of an Anti-Tank Gun, Mortar and Machine Gun

These will all be critical to fighting (and winning!) the ten scenarios this booklet contains, all focused on those crucial 2 weeks of Christmas 1944 in the Ardennes. The first six scenarios included are all standard scenarios, playable with a single base game and this expansion alone (though a Memoir '44: Winter/Desert Board Map will add a nice cosmetic touch to your battlefield). The four scenarios that follow are gigantic Breakthrough renditions of the Battle of the Bulge. These will require a single copy of the already released Memoir '44: Eastern Front expansion, and the Memoir '44: Breakthrough maps, in addition to the aforementionned expansion.

Name: Plantmanager: Build Your Own Plant
Description:
From the Back of the Box:
Build Your Own Plant is the result of a unique collaboration between the branch FHI Industrial Automation and the developer and publisher of games; 999 Games. The game is designed and produced for the exhibition HET Instrument 2010.

Players are managers whom get a very clear assignment. Automate and improve and old rundown factory and turn it into a profit generating money machine. Processes are improved to obtain better quality, a higher efficiency, lower costs ans HSE needs to be improved to meet the necessary standards.

Improving your plant alone isn't quite enough in this game. Buying resources and selling goods is an integral part of the game and the way profitable companies operate. The simulated markets emphasise the need to buy and sell wisely.

The players are experienced Plantmanagers hired by the owner of a plant in need of modernisation. They have to upgrade the machines with products and services from the FHI members to improve the quality and quantity of the plant's output. To do so, resources are bought, processed and the final products are sold on the market.

Each round players select actions by putting they playing pieces on action spaces. For each action they play an Event card, Purchase resources, takes improvement cards, gets the HSE bonus, sells goods, pays OPEX, pays maintenance and pays taxes.

At the end of five years the managers are judged on their performance. The most valuable production plant with the most capital scores the most points.

Name: Magical Strike
Description:
From the rules: Magical Strike is a free cooperative miniature figure game inspired by anime series Strike Witches.

Defend the Earth! Only the teenage Witches, with the help of 1940’s best flying technology the Striker units, can stop the alien Neuroi invasion. Fly over the massive Neuroi, clearing beam points, while searching for the core. Hurry, to the core segments and destroy them before the Neuroi reaches your home base! Each turn the Neuroi will charge up its deadly beams and attack any Witches that get too close!

Magical Strike is a team game. One or more players try and beat the Neuroi, while it responds according to the game rules. You all win or lose together!

Everything you need to play can be found online here:
https://docs.google.com/document/edit?id=1axUiJQdptkzo2JK1Db6yfjunfldD8iys3-R3JisdH3c&hl=en#

Name: Balloon Tycoon
Description:
Balloons make people happy, and making people happy can make a fella rich.  So naturally you want more balloons! ... But there’s a string attached (actually many strings) ... because so does everyone else.

In Balloon Tycoon players try to build collections of balloons (by linking similar coloured balloons together) to fulfill a particular game winning goal ... but beware! ... that goal can change at any moment.

Game play is simple. On your turn you take a card and then you play a card. But what card will you play?  Will you play a Balloon Card to build up your collection? Will you play an Action Card to wreak havoc on your opponents? Or will you play a Goal Card so you can win?

Just remember, what goes around comes around! And other players can win with your Goal just as easily as you can!

Name: Dornröschen
Description: In this memory game the players rolling the die and with a good memory fight their way through the thorny hedge to wake Sleeping Beauty from her 100 year sleep. The thorns only open when the correct hedge tiles are turned over. Which ones are the correct ones is determined by the colour die. Who is the first to reach Sleeping Beauty’s bed is the winner of the game.

Name: Benni Bücherwurm
Description: This game helps children to learn to distinguish between colours and to recognize opposites. The game also trains motor abilities. A variant of the game, Bücher Salat, is a 'threading game', the symbols of the dice must be correctly combined and players thread Benni through the corresponding book. The first player running out of books wins the game. In the variant 'Bücher schnappen' reaction is added, where the symbols must be combined and the correct book snatched up from the table. The player who grabs the most books wins the game.

Name: Mini-Dominari
Description:
This game is played on a 4 x 4 field. Each player has three playing pieces numbered 1, 2 and 3. These can be moved forward straight or diagonally and can also jump over other pieces, but only forward, never backwards. The goal is to put all three pieces out of the opposite corner of the field.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

Name: Shafted
Description: Players explore caverns and mine the mystical gems contained within. Nodes within the caverns contain a supply of each of the 3 types of gems: Red, Blue, and Yellow. Players can only mine each node once and the color they choose is then unavailable to the other players for that node. The gems are used to perform the three actions in the game: Red - mine, Blue - refill movement points, Yellow - reveal a new cavern.  The game ends when a player reaches the master chamber (center) and then exits the mine. Scoring consists of multiplying your least common gems by 3 and then adding that to your most common gems.

Name: Luftikus & Sausewind
Description:
The aim of the game is to thread as quickly as possible six loops on the dragon's tail and push away the clouds. At the beginning, each player has a dragon, which is covered with three clouds. After that, the players in turn roll a special dice (4 color 2 Symbol markings). Depending on if the color match, a loop symbol may be taken. The winner is the player who first has threaded hiss loops on the dragon's tail.

The game is for small children (around 3), a first game with simple rules. The children learn to thread (loops), different color names.

Name: Power Grid: Warehouse
Description:
Power Grid: Warehouse (Funkenschlag - Lagerhalle) is part of the Power Grid: BGG Promo Card Set.

It was originally a limited edition 3 card set for Power Grid (aka Funkenschlag 2nd Edition) available for a donation at the Essen Spiel show 2010.

You can store up to three resources of any type in the Warehouse for future use in your own power plants. Stored resources cannot be dumped and must be used in the power plants.

The two "event cards" either remove three tokens of the cheapest resource or add three tokens of the most expensive resource from or to the resource market (only one token, if this is uranium).

If there is a tie for cheapest or most expensive, resolve in the order coal, oil, garbage, uranium.

Name: The Battle for Normandy: Expansion
Description:
(based on GMT website description, italicized text is additional:)

This Expansion Set for The Battle for Normandy allows players to extend the campaign game to the end of August, but most importantly includes the area for the Mortain and Falaise Pocket scenarios.
 Counters are included to fill out Allied and Axis Order of Battles to the end of August, and also include specific breakdown counters for AT, SP AT, and mechanized infantry.
 The Full Color Rules & Scenario books are updated and comprehensive, and include all original rules and scenarios plus all optional rules, and 6 new scenarios.
 Components:

    1 Rulebook (color): Original rules plus updates and all addtional optional rules (40 pages - dated 2013)
    1 Scenario book (color): Originals plus 6 additional including Falaise Gap, Mortain and Operation Totalize - 12 scenarios in total (64 pages- dated 2013).
    Two full maps; the top halves of which will overlap Maps D & E, taking it just over a half map South. These will be back-printed with mid-map projections for scenarios
         map ABC on one side / map G on other side
         map CE on one side / map F on other side
    
    1 8-1/2 x 11" color map section: (Utah Beach area) cardstock
    2 full countersheets (560 counters) - [...] counters to fill out the OOB to the end of August, optional type-specific breakdown counters (AT, SP AT, mech infantry, etc.) and replacements counters
         4 new German infantry divisions, 1 US infantry division, 1 US armored division, German coastal batteries Fire arc limited, Marker counters for optional rules (Weather forecast, Commando REM repl, CW/US air & supply allocation planning), errata counters (including counters published in C3I #24)
        Princess Irene Brigade & the Belgian brigade, "Tac Move" & "Isolated" markers, etc...

Name: Monty Python's Really Silly Board Game
Description:
If you’re a fan of Monty Python or just plain silly, then this Really Silly Board Game will have you laughing like Ernest Scribbler as you travel the board collecting Spam. Test your knowledge of Monty Python TV and movie trivia, undertake silly challenges and explore the wickedly funny world of Monty Python.

- A board game for adults combining Monty Python trivia, charades, impressions and silly behaviour
- Features 6 characters: Gumby, Knight of Ni, Spanish Inquisitor, Mr Creosote, Lumberjack & Brian of Nazareth
- Trade Spam pieces for Quest items and complete your quest to win the game
- 400 silly questions and hilarious tasks such as ‘Who’s got the funniest silly walk?'
- An ideal break from the usual Christmas ‘bored’ game!

Name: Honigbär und Stachelbiene
Description: In the game, up to six bears try to create a store of honey. On the field, around a meadow, are six bear caves. In the middle of the meadow there are the bees. Every player has a choice to move the bears or the bees.The bears move exactly four steps, and if they cross one, they can lift honey pots, which they try as quickly as possible to transport to their caves. When moving the bee you roll a special die (2x honey symbol 3,4,5,6). The honey bee is then moved to a space and on their old space is a honey pot is laid. The bees can also chase the bears, if caught the affected bears lose the honey and start again in the cave. Honey which is already in the cave is safe. The winner is the bear who has a full stock (adjusted according to players) collected first.

Name: Hallo Herr Bär
Description: "Hello Mr. Bear" is part of the Haba series "From 2 years," an infants-game series from Haba. The game is several games within a game. The game has no board but rather it is made up of a house that can be built up, it has three walls and an open side, and several wooden figures that can be positioned within the house. The first game supports listening and understanding of words and figures and the fine motor skills. Other games are simple memory games where the children try to remember which figures have been placed in the house.

Name: Luca und die Farbenschafe
Description: Luca and his white dog Baldur are to look after the tinted colour-sheep. The little shepherd leads the green sheep to a very green meadow, but what does that yellow sheep need? A book for reading out loud, to look at, to tell stories, a story on colours and tinted sheep, and a game in which to roll the die and thread the sheep onto a woollen string. Luca moves from spot to spot, if all the sheep and the dog are threaded before the sun sinks, all animals can sleep in the barn and the game is won.

Name: Idéspelet
Description: Idéspelet is both a board game and a creativity tool. In the game the players create ideas around a given question and pitch-battle these against each other. The greatest ideas advance in rank and the weaker go back for another iteration and another chance. In the end the player with the highest ranking is proclaimed the winner.

Name: Taxibo
Description:
From the rules:
Taxibo is a unique Surinamese board game, which takes you by taxi through the centre of Paramaribo. It is a game for 2 to 4 players and consists of 1 dice, 16 pieces in 4 colours and a board.

From the website:
First Surinamese boardgame, developed by Gerrit Baron for the whole family. Taxibo is a taxi game which takes place in Paramaribo. Each of the four players owns a taxi company, who's four cars stand in four different garages. very exciting and above all educational.

Discription: Taxibo is a basic role and move game with some similarities to Sorry. Players move their pawns (taxi's) by rolling dice. The board represents (in an very abstract manner) the streets of Paramaribo. The end goal is getting all four taxi's to the central square. The players who first achieves this wins. Some of the spaces of the board are related to famous sights in Paramaribo and require a player who lands on them to do things such as skip turns, roll again, etc.

Name: Остров Страха
Description:
From publisher:

The Island of Fear 
Can you survive until sunrise?

A plane carrying a group of tourists to the Maldives crashes in the Indian Ocean. On the first night after the crash, the survivors realize that there were werewolves on the plane with them. These fiends organized the whole crash so that they could hunt down some humans in the moonlight. There is only one way to survive until the rescue crew arrives – find out who the werewolves are and lynch them.

The Island of Fear is probably the most advanced version of the world-renowned Mafia game. First of all, in addition to the normal tourists and werewolves, there is a sexual predator, a clairvoyant, a nurse, a witch, an untouchable, a nightwalker, a half-blood werewolf and even a were-hamster. All sorts of nasty surprises can be expected from this colorful group of people.  Second, the game contains a set of event cards that create specific events as the game progresses. Third, there are object cards that can both help or hinder the owner. Finally, the game comes with a DVD with mood-setting backgrounds and a timer for day-time voting. Also included are a chart and voting tokens to help manage the game.

Name: Assassin X
Description:
Nobody knows who or when, but one player is going to be the killer! Discretion and assassination attempt on one side, and vigileance stalking each other. Suspense guaranteed!

Assassin X is based on a user specific trading card (55 originals cards) through which you build your game and influence your opponents. It is a game of strategy and psychology in which deception and bluff you will need to win!

The goal of the game is the first player to have 5 pts.  You gains points if 
1) Successful murder = 2 points
2) Countering murder = 1 point
3) Discover an assassin = 1 point

Each player receives 5 cards that they keep secret.
The rest is the deck face down. A sense of play is defined for a turn. It will be inverted at each new turn.
Each round takes place in two stages:
- A phase of trading between 2 players.
- A phase of action for any player

If you receive the card or draw Assassin
you become a murderer. Unless you try to get rid of it, you should prepare your murder by collecting maximum points with maps of Crime Guns, Approaches,and Masters. However, be careful not to be detect because it may well be another player sends you the Police and there, it would be over.
Assassinate when you're ready!

Name: Silent War: IJN – Imperial Japanese Navy
Description:
(from Compass Games website:)

Bring added realism to your submarine campaign with IJN, Imperial Japanese Navy, the first expansion pack for Compass Games’ award winning SILENT WAR.

Every Japanese warship down through the large destroyer escorts and the major auxiliary cargo ships and tankers are provided in two full countersheets with 336 new playing pieces for the game and rules to integrate them seamlessly into the game. IJN, Imperial Japanese Navy also brings new rules to SILENT WAR such as loners, crash dive, and targeting escorts, rules introduced in the follow on game, STEEL WOLVES.

A must have expansion pack for any dedicated SILENT WAR player. Requires SILENT WAR to play.

Description from publisher:

Un juego "pipí cucú" para revivir lo más divertido de la época.

En este juego, los setentosos y ochentosos, tienen que contestar  preguntas, actuar, dibujar, silbar y mucho más...recordando lo más 
divertido de la época.

¿Te animás a actuar representando al "Super agente 86" y dibujar un balero...o al Correcaminos; y a silbar "Menta y Limón"... o "Cleopatra"?


Is a mix between Trivial Pursuit, Pictionary and acting, everything based on the music, tv, movies and culture of the 70s and 80s.  Players must act, answer questions, draw, whistle, and sing in various competitions.

Name: Mission Ascent
Description:
User summary:

A religious educational board game that introduces Catholics to the saints and their missions. Intended to help players understand God's calling in their own lives. Includes a book on the 76 featured saints.

Players move their pewter figurines around the board a la Monopoly. When landing on a color-coded square they answer one of four questions read from corresponding cards:

Blue - Light or humorous
Green - Scripture memory
Red - Thoughtful, reflective
Yellow - Lives of the saints

The first person to fully navigate the board by successfully answering questions wins.

The game takes about an hour to play and is geared to ages 10 and up. The goal is to learn more about one's faith, one's mission in life, and about the calling in other players' lives.

Name: Age of Frederick the Great
Description:
User Summary

Age of Frederick the Great - Wargame Rules for the Seven Years War is a miniatures rules set that includes a card-driven resolution system.

Rules cover sequence of play, movement, terrain effects, fire, melee, morale and rally, the leader action cards (and how to create them), game scale, and unit and army organization.

Rules set appears in Wargames Illustrated #178 (July 2002)

Name: What's Up, Doc? The Bugs Bunny Game
Description:
From the box front: Raid Elmer Fudd's vegetable patch and collect the most carrots

User summary: At the start of the game, players get a supply of carrots.  On each turn, every player gets a card.  When any two vegetable cards match, everyone grabs for a Bugs Bunny piece, with enough for every player but one (i.e. three Bugs pieces for four players).  Whoever does not get a Bugs piece must give a carrot to the other players.  In addition, there are three Elmer Fudd cards.  If one of these turns up, no one should grab for Bugs.  If they do touch Bugs, they must give up two carrots to each other player.  The same penalty applies for touching Bugs when there are no matching cards.

When one player runs out of carrots, the game is over, and the player with the most carrots wins.

Name: Fast Play Armada Rules
Description:
From the Introduction

"Last year I promised to present for discussion a set of rules covering the Armada period of naval warfare. Here are those rules, or rather a fast play version of the Channel Wargames Group's current set.

"The philosophy behind them is both to make an attempt to make a set of rules that give a good flavour of the period and the methods of fighting with ships current at that time. And to make the games played with them as enjoyable as is possible. Because of this things such as gunnery have been simplified as much as possible.

"Ships gunnery at the time of the Armada was a thing in a state of flux. It is as well to contemplate, that ships carried many different types of ordinance, all intermingled together on the same deck. The logistics of serving such a varied armament in a rapid manner was beyond the capabilities of the time, and I would hazard a guess beyond us today as well. Most authorities give a maximum rate of fire for the guns of the Spaniards as once, yes once, a day. Small pieces and hand held weapons were obviously much quicker to reload. Even the English rate of fire is said to have been at best once an hour. If this difference had been used in the rules the Spanish player's would be sitting on their for much of the game, and the English for quite long periods. The solution to this problem can be read in the rules themselves..."

User Summary

Rules set covers scale, speed of units, sailing rules, handling classes, wind effects, firing, ranges, firing charts, special effects table (effectively a sort of critical hit table), putting out fires, effects of bowing on hull factors, boarding, morale, special rules for galleys, a ship list, and a brief bibliography. Game requires models (1/600 preferred for ease of scratch building), and two types of dice (d6 & d20).

Rules set appears in Wargames Illustrated #178 (July 2002)

Name: Archeoegypt
Description: A gorgeous game in resin, coming in a huge wooden box. Two players or teams must dig for the Pharao's treasure, finding hints that will help them in the search. The valley of the Sphinx is made of little 3D spaces in resin that can be lifted to see what's under. A guide with the reproduction of real ancient Egyptian documents is featired to translate the hieroglyphics and identify Pharaos' names. The cost was impressive (150.000 liras - equivalent of 77.50 euros that was a really huge sum in mid '90s).

Name: Hour of the Gun: Tombstone, Arizona, 1881-2
Description:
User Summary

Hour of the Gun - Tombstone, Arizona, 1881-2 is a set of three linked miniatures scenarios and a rules set that covers the events surrounding the infamous gunfight at the OK Corral. Scenarios include: Street Fight at the Ok Corral, Tucson Stockyards Ambush, & Shootout at Iron Springs. Characters surviving a scenario (from either the Earp or Clanton faction) are eligible to appear in the next scenario. Off table events (like an assassination attempt on the Earps) between the scenarios help to build suspense.

Effectively this is a set of skirmish scenarios with characters that are drawn from history. Characters that didn't appear at the events in question, but that might have, are included in charts of "Improbables." Historical figures that did participate are found in the "Probable" charts, and have a much higher chance of participating. Percentile dice are used to determine the characters in the various scenarios.

Each character has their own set of characteristics which include: Reaction, Control, Bravery, Dexterity, Agility, Physical, Panic Distance, Security Distance, Pistol Skill, Rifle Skill, Hand Weapon Skill, & Fists Skill.

Game requires various old west miniatures and terrain, along with 2d10 for percentile rolls and single d10 rolls.

Rules set appears in Wargames Illustrated #178 (July 2002)

Name: Svoyi Koziri
Description:
Russian card game of attacking and getting rid of all cards. Originally a game for two, three or four players, it's mostly known today in an adapted version for two players brought into England by the Mathematics professor A.S. Besikovitch, and later included in David Parlett's Oxford Guide to Card Games. This version is played with exposed cards and symmetrical hands, giving it a strong strategic flavour.

At the beginning of the (Besikovitch) game each player chooses two sets without overlapping with the other player, typically in a 32-card deck, out of which one is their own trump. Cards are dealt for the first player, who keeps the cards of their both sets; the second player gets exactly the same cards in the other sets and both their hands are filled up with the rest of the cards. As an example: a player who's chosen spades and clubs with spades as trumps keeps the cards in both sets and gives all their red cards together with the undealt cards to the other player, who then selects the analog cards to the first player's in the red sets with hearts as trumps, gives the rest of the red cards back to the first player and finally keeps all the remaining black cards. Both hands are symmetrical, and play can start.

From now on each turn a player lays a card in a pile between both players; before the next player can play out a card of their choice they must throw one that is superior in value to the top card in the pile or a trump. If the player can't or doesn't want to do so they must take the whole pile and forfeit the turn. So, each player throws two cards in a row: one following the previous card, and one to be followed by the opponent. The first player to get rid of all cards in their hand is the winner.

Name: Party 'Til You Puke
Description:
From the box: "A Game With No Redeeming Qualities"

A roll and move drinking game where you move your piece around a game board arranged like a person's home. The object of the game is to be the first player to get from the front door to the bathroom.

Name: Lindenstraße
Description:
This is a TV tie-in with the popular eponymous German TV series.

Players move around the board trying to collect 1 chip from each of the 6 houses on the street. To collect a chip, a player has to answer a question concerning the show correctly. After collecting all 6 chips, the player needs to answer a master question correctly to win.

There are several inbuilt variants for more or less competitive/cut-throat play.

Name: Star Fleet Battles: Module Y3 – Early Years III
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

Module Y3 comprises a 100-page SSD book, including: 
Early battleships for the Federation, Kzintis, and Gorns.

Warp-refitted command cruisers for the rest of the Federation member states before the unified star fleet was formed.

Warp-driven dreadnoughts for the five member species of the Inter-Stellar Concordium before they coalesced into one nation.

The 64-page rulebook includes five scenarios as well as the ship descriptions and annexes.

Name: Lost Complete Victory: Legend of the Galactic Heroes
Description:
This is a Japanese science fiction wargame set in the universe of the Legend of the Galactic Heroes.

Two scenarios are contained in the game, and the fictional space battle that each was drawn in the story is reproduced. These are being called a fleet battle, but when either is said, it is close to the land battle of Napoleonic age.

Each player control one or more star fleets. 
Each fleet is commanded by one admiral, and organized by 10 to 20 ships units.

Each turn, a fleet are activated in the unintentional order by chit-pull system, and it resolves a movement and a combat. 
An average admiral has only one or two chits. But the heroes of the story has four or more chits, and it is activated  many times during one turn. 
A battle is resolved with adjacent hex on the Odds CRT.

The outcome is decided by the number which made a fleet collapse. A fleet collapses when a fixed unit is eliminate or admiral's mental agitation.
Families: Setting: Legend of the Galactic Heroes

Name: Vermilion: Legend of the Galactic Heroes
Description:
This is a Japanese science fiction wargame set in the universe of the Legend of the Galactic Heroes.

Seven scenarios are contained in the game, and the fictional space battle that each was drawn in the story is reproduced. These are being called a fleet battle, but when either is said, it is close to the land battle of Napoleonic age.

Each player control one or more star fleets. 
Each fleet is commanded by one admiral, and organized by 10 to 20 ships units.

Each turn, a fleet are activated in the unintentional order by chit-pull system, and it resolves a movement and a combat. 
An average admiral has only one or two chits. But the heroes of the story has four or more chits, and it is activated  many times during one turn. 
A battle is resolved with adjacent hex on the Odds CRT.

The outcome is decided by the number which made a fleet collapse. A fleet collapses when a fixed unit is eliminate or admiral's mental agitation.
Families: Setting: Legend of the Galactic Heroes

Name: Mutsu Nikki
Description:
This is self-published expansion kit for ç‹¬çœ¼ç«œæ”¿å®— (Dokuganryu Masamune). Rulebook and reference card from ç§€å‰è»è¨˜ (Hideyoshi Gunki) or later game are needed.
"Mutsu Nikki" means "Record of the Mutsu province".

Covering battles in the Mutsu and Dewa provinces.
Six scenarios are included in this kit. "Battle of Eiroku 1", "Battle of Eiroku 2", "Punitive expedition to Ooura" and "Battle of Minato" are short games for two players. "Three champions of Dewa" is a short three players game. "Mutsu Nikki" is a campaign game for three or four players.

Name: Sengoku Gunyuden supplement kit
Description:
This is expansion kit for ä¿¡çŽ„ä¸Šæ´› (Shingen Joraku). also needs é–¢æ±åˆ¶åœ§ (Kanto Seiatsu), ä¿¡é•·é¢¨é›²éŒ² (Nobunaga Fuun-roku), ç§€å‰è»è¨˜ (Hideyoshi Gunki), The Longest Day in Sengoku.

Covering battles of Oda-Tokugawa alliance versus Takeda clan.

Two scenarios are included in this kit:

    "Shingen's Last Battle 2nd Edition" is expansion version of "ä¿¡çŽ„ä¸Šæ´› (Shingen Joraku). Large campaign scenario for two players. One player controls Takeda, Hojo clans and western coalition. The other player controls Oda, Tokugawa and Uesugi clans.
    "Battle of Nagashino - Nobunaga's Victory" is short game for two players.

Name: Cars: Radiator Springs Rallye Small Expansion
Description:
Small expansion for the base game:

It comes with 4 new cars:
Ramone
Luigi
Guido
The King

Allows now the game to played up to 10 players.

And adds a new route as well called: "Even Longer". (Just adds 2 more tiles, with Luigi and The King special places.)

Name: Activity Superthema Freizeit und Essen
Description:
Expansion to Activity with 220 new cards. Themes: leisure and food

The gameboard and pawns are needed from one of the basic Activity games.
Most of the new cards have book-, film- or play titels (theatre, opera, music), fairy tales or poems to be guessed by the teams 
Also tasks about art and architecture, everything around food and kitchen and last but not least - games are includet in this theme pack.
It's a real challenge, to "dance" or picture the title of a poem, you might have learned in school - but will your teammates remember it too?

The minimum age is specified with 12, but 30 to 40 is best "experience-level"

Name: Quanto
Description:
A computation game for 2-4 players from 8-14 years

Contents: 4 men, 4 boards - each showing a pair of scales with adjustable weight figures, 60 tiles showing weight units from 1-60, track with 22 spaces.

1. Zero! Each player adjusts his scale so that it shows zero.
2. Two! Each player draws two weight-tiles and puts one on each side of his scale. It is up to hom which tile goes on the left and which tile goes on the right.
3. Quanto! Players draw a third tile an can place it either on the right or left side of their scales.
4. Got it! The first player who succeeds in balancing his scale by adjusting the dials scores most points

Name: Die Bar-Bolz-Bande: Das Kartenspiel
Description:
Football simulation for 2 to 6 players. The game consists of defense cards, midfield cards, attack cards and action cards. Each move is started by playing a midfield card. The cards have a color code that determines which kinds of cards can be played next (i.e. an attack card (red) can only be played if the previous card contains a red color code). Attack cards also show a number of balls that has to be surpassed by the next player. A player who cannot counter an attack card catches a goal and has to take all the cards from the current stack; the last player to play an attack card before that takes a scoring card. When the card stack is used up, the player with most scoring cards is the winner. 
Action cards can be used to reverse player order, pass an attack to the next player, etc.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

Name: Auf der schwäbischen Eisenbahn
Description:
A dice rolling game with a colour dice, little plastic goats in 4 colours and 4 trains for transportation.

Goal is, to transport the goats through the swabian country following an old popular folksong "Auf der schwäbschen Eisenbahn"

Name: Die kleine Hexe: nach dem Buch von Ottfried Preußler
Description: In this game - following the children's book of Ottfried Preußler with the same name, each player will play the little sorceress once. The little sorceress tries to break the evil witches operations. So she attempts to burn the grimoires and witches' brooms. That child, whichs acts best, will win.

Name: Peregrinus
Description:
The XVII. the king scented the plans of the noblemen conspiring against it in England on a century's waist, that down it wants to be repelled from the throne. He deprived all those, who were getting involved in a suspicion, of their title, their property and their name because of this. As a last opportunity, offered it to the ones driven into the exile in order for them to prove their innocence, that who gets into the utmost nook of his realm as the first, it proves it with his desperation, worthy that way, that gets back his goods taken away. Your rivals will make your road harder, save up at what more thalers, that give yourself to benefits and be able to hold back your adversaries.

Be the most resolute one and reach the aim, the long one and tiring one firstly on a road, defying the obstacles, that regain all that, from which falsely bereft!

Peregrinus is a game that is still under development and just before publishing. Consequently, the rules are not complete yet but are still changing. In the game you have to come up with different colour combinations with four cards, and you can proceed in the game with these combinations. You can collect money, points, action cards and treasures. All this will be converted into victory points at the end of the game. You can create obstacles for your opponents, and you can turn the action cards into your advantage but can also annoy your opponents with these cards.

The aim of the game is to collect the most VPs

Name: Life of Christ: Bible Journeys No. 2
Description:
Follow the life of Christ from Bethlehem to Calvary.  Players move along a path that follows the events of the life of Christ and answer questions on cards that are drawn.  First player to the end wins.

User Summary

Name: Temple
Description:
This is a game for 2 players. You need 1 set of Nestortiles.

Each player chooses 5 colours and takes the corresponding tiles.
One player begins by placing a tile valued 1 on to the table. Then the players continue alternately.

On his turn a player puts 1 to 3 (dependent on the move type) tiles onto the table. There are 6 possibilities to extend the building:

(Floor tiles are tiles directly on the table, wall tiles are vertical tiles and top tiles are horizontal tiles not touching the table)


    Floor - A tile directly on the table touching at least one other tile.
    Corner Wall - Two adjacent vertical tiles with an inbetween angle of 90°, both touching a floor tile.
    Single Wall - A vertical tile touching at least one other wall tile. It also has to touch a floor or top tile.
    Tunnel - The top tile has to touch exactly one wall tile, and may additionally touch one or more top tiles. On the opposite side of the touching wall side another wall is placed.
    Single Top - A top tile touching at least 2 wall tiles.
    Corner Top - A top tile touching at least 2 other top tiles but no wall tile. On every side not touching another top tile a wall tile is added.


There are some additional restrictions for the moves:

The players have to use the tiles colour by colour. Only if the first used colour is completely placed on the table, the next colour may be used. So if there is only one tile remaining in a colour the player can only place one tile in his next turn.  The colour by colour rule is meant to be for the tiles of one player. Example: Player A starts with a yellow tile. Player B continues with two green tiles. Now player A has to continue with yellow until all yellow is used. Only then player A may choose his next colour. (Same for player B with green)

Each placed tile has to touch at least one tile with the same or a smaller value.  The dots of the top tiles always must be on the top side. So it is not possible to have a top directly above a floor.

A player wins if he places all 30 tiles on the table.
A player loses if he has no legal move (Beware of tiles with small value).

Name: Nagashino Shitaragahara
Description:
Issue game of Wargame Japanese History #7.

Small card-driven game covering a famous battle during the Sengoku era.
In 1575, Katsuyori Takeda ((æ­¦ç”° å‹é ¼) invaded Mikawa controlled by Ieyasu Tokugawa (å¾³å· å®¶åº·). Nobunaga Oda decided to reinforce Tokugawa. He fought Takeda's traditional horsemen with innovative tactics and arquebusiers.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Nagashino

Takeda must conquer the Nagashino castle before the game ends and Tokugawa must prevent him to succeed.

Components:

    1 map
    80 counters
    4 pages rulebook
    30 cards
    2 dice

Name: Guided Lands
Description:
Guided Lands - Tabletop battles for all fantasy miniatures

Guided Lands is a new tabletop game for two players, ages 14 and up. The game has an universal approach to tabletop gaming, where almost all fantasy miniatures with a scale around 28mm can be fielded in battle. Players take on the role of two mighty warlords, who muster their troops to claim the throne and be crowned king of the Guided Lands. Doing so players will use a unique step-by-step approach to create different races and equip their soldiers with weapons, armor and special abilities, thus making nearly all of your fantasy miniatures you have lying around somewhere ready to be used as heroes or units in Guided Lands. The scale ranges from small skirmishes to epic battles including monsters, magic and powerful artillery. An easy and streamlined ruleset as well as a card-driven initiative system keeps gameplay fast, while also engaging for seasoned tabletop generals. So dust of your old miniatures and start playing!

Guided Lands is the first game of the new publisher Smiling Monster Games and will be released in a limited first edition of 500 copies at Essen Spiel 2010 in German language (Hall 6, booth 6-808), estimated price € 20 (softcover book).

More information at www.smiling-monster.de

Name: Nihonsyoki
Description:
This is the oldest book in Japan for history related in Japan.
It is 30 volumes and is the fantasy story. The player are the editors for Nihon syoki.
They collect the category cards, and make the book, put the tile on the board corresponded the space. The spaces are connected by lines to some space.
These are the story's web.
The game is 6 rounds. The player has the 1 action on 3 each areas per 1 round. Get the category card, bonus card, make the book, change the order and so on.

45 Category card
 3 Library card
12 Offering card
24 Point card
18 Bonus card
40 Player tile(10 per player)
 1 Round Maker
 4 Board(They can make any patterns)
 1 Round / Action Board
 1 Rule

Name: ¿Conoces España?
Description:
From the instructions booklet cover:

Educational game. Geography, History, folklore, industry and commerce of Spain.

Components: (User Summary):

-72 round pieces
-Map in six sections of 34x16cm each
-Rules booklet

Goal:

Players must fill the spaces in the map with the pieces corresponding to each location.

Game mechanics:

Players must fill the spaces in the map with the counters pulled out randomly from any opaque container after identyfing the correct location for each.
There are three levels of difficulty (low, medium, high).

Juego instructivo. Geografia, Historia, costumbres, industria y comercio de España.

Componentes:

-72 fichas circulares de cartón 
-Mapa en seis secciones rectangulares de 34x16cm cada una.
-Instrucciones

Objetivo:

Los jugadores deben rellenar el mapa con las fichas correspondientes a cada localización.

Mecánica de juego:

Los jugadores van extrayendo las fichas de cualquier recipiente opaco y tras identificar el lugar al que pertenecen las van colocando en el mapa. 
Existen tres niveles de dificultad (elemental, medio, superior).

Name: Le Loto Des Saveurs
Description:
A follow-up to Le Loto Des Odeurs, Le Loto Des Saveurs attempts to teach children about flavours.

The game contains 30 jars with tiny candies, and 30 cards with images of the different flavours. Each turn, one jar is opened and each player gets a candy. They now try to identify the flavour as quickly as possible. A player that wants to make a guess grabs the corresponding card, after which his guess is verified by the game master.

The game is won by the player who has guessed the most flavours correctly at the end of the game.

Name: Zomboree
Description:
Zomboree is a large group social card game (6 - 16 people) where players take on the roles of various survivors in a town under seige by zombies.  Each turn is affected by an event card drawn for that day.  Each turn is divided into two phases: Day and Night.  A 90 second timer is provided with the game to provide a  fair length for both phases.

During setup, survivor cards will be handed out.  One of the survivors will be Patient Zero and become a zombie at the end of the first day.  Each survivor starts with one item.  After everyone has an item, the group elects their leader.  Since no one knows anyone else's role, it is possible to elect Patient Zero as the group's leader.  Anytime the leader becomes a zombie, the survivors must elect a new leader before beginning the day phase.

During the day the elected leader of the survivors draws resource cards and the survivors discuss how to divide them up.  Some of the Survivors, however, are infected and will eventually join the Zombies attacking the Survivors.  At the end of each day, players check their character cards to see if they have become a zombie.

During the night, the players who have become zombies play attack cards of various types against the remaining survivors.  The survivors must work together to defend themselves using the resources they found during the day to resist and shunt off zombie attacks in order to survive.  Those who cannot stop or deflect a zombie attack, become zombies who will get a zombie attack card the next night.

The game's scenario runs for one week's time, from Sunday to Saturday.  Each turn an event card shapes both the day and night phases.  Each day the survivors use their drawn resources to make a plan for resisting the zombies.  Each night the zombies attack the survivors and try to wipe them out.  The game ends after the night phase on Saturday when those still alive win by surviving the zombie apocalypse, or else when all survivors are   dead (or undead, as it were).

Name: SuperMark som købmand
Description:
Finally a card game about shopping, with pedagogic opportunities for dialogue, as well as super fun action with the sneaky SuperMark action cards. In this fun SuperMark game you will have to go shopping for your family. Each participant draws a shopping list, but do not think you'll be a certain winner, because as soon as you are closing in on the goods on your shopping list, an opponent can play the action card "switch shopping list", and then you will have to find the goods on that list.

The SuperMark card games come in five different variations, each one with its own theme. The games are especially good for pre-school children, as they will learn how to, purely motorically, hold the cards, and they get practice in colours, combinations, numbers and relations.

Name: SuperMark som postbud
Description:
Card games don't come better than this. You'll each draw a post card and with the help of a few questions, observations and memory, you will have to try to give the post card to the right person.

The SuperMark card games come in five different variations, each with their own theme. The games are especially good for pre-school children, as they will learn how to, purely motorically, hold the cards, and they get practice in colours, combinations, numbers and relations.

Name: SuperMark som superhelt
Description:
SuperMark is a sympathetic and easy beginner game. The game where good deeds are rewarded. The optimal beginner card game, where the child has at most three cards on their hand at all times. In this fun card game you'll have to avert an accident. Play a accident card on the table, for example a boy who's about to jump in a swimming pool without water, and then find the hero card in which SuperMark pours water into the pool. The game consists of 40 super nice cards - with fun hero deeds.

The SuperMark card games come in five different variations, each with their own theme. The games are especially good for pre-school children, as they will learn how to, purely motorically, hold the cards, and they get practice in colours, combinations, numbers and relations.

Name: Piro
Description:
This card game is played mainly in Afganistan and Iran. It was mentioned in an article in GAMES magazine, sometime in the 2000s. It is similar to, but differs a fair bit (scoring and key cards), from the card game known as Casino and another called "Bazra".

The game uses a standard 52-card deck, without jokers. After an initial deal of five cards to each person (2-player only), two cards are turned up in the middle of the table. After playing one card at a time from the hand, another 5 cards are dealt to the players once their current hand is empty. Thus, each game segment lasts 5 rounds (10 cards per round + the initial 2 card outlay).

Points (always 5 per game segment) are given at the end of the deck for the following:
Most cards = 2
Most clubs = 1
2 of clubs = 1
10 of diamonds = 1

See the A new 2-player card game (for most of you) for a visual explanation of rules and scoring basics.

Name: Bauer sucht Frau: Das Kartenspiel
Description:
Party game based on a German TV show. The game consists of cards with sentence starts and four possible endings. Each player also has a set of four guessing cards (A-D, one for each answer) and some heart chips. The sentences deal mostly with men/women stereotypes.
In each round, a player reads the sentence and the four endings, then each player chooses an answer option. Then pairs are assigned and the two players try to guess what answer the other player chose. The first successful pair exchanges heart chips. If only one player guessed correctly, he/she gets a single point. After 12 rounds, heart chips are counted, with multiple chips in the same color counting less than a diversity of colors. Bonus points are added and the player with most points is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

Name: Muchachada Nui: el juego de mesa
Description:
This is a card game based on a Spanish TV show of "strange" humor and parodies for 3-4 players. You'll find many characters from this program and have some laughs. In the game of Muchachada Nui the players, in the paper of surrealistic television producers, pay the cache of important Celebrities to gain hearing points. The first program that arrives to the maximum level of hearing will be proclaimed as the winner. Just play the cards to get points as you use your Celebrities and cards to stop other players in this TV race.

From the publisher:

There is a hollow in the grill of programming of Spanish television. The managers are very worried and hopelessly looking for a new program. As young producer you must prepare your best TV program of varieties and you have a great list of personalities  for it. Contract the surrealistic Celebrities, discover to the public the most incredible histories and create a spectacular Plate to captivate the spectators. Only the program with more success will finish within the programming!

But care, the Celebrities that you can contract not only attracts the hearing. All has special qualities: Samantha Fox and Sabrina Salerno attract masculine  Celebrities of the program of an opponent, Bud Spencer can leave them out of action with a hand strike and you do not want to know what happens when Chuck Norris appears in action. Freddy Krueger has nightmares with Chuck Norris!

Also it adds to your program special sections like the Tertulianos, the Tontiploster, the Klamstein or the Consultation of Junior Rappel to call even more the attention of the spectators and decorates your Plate with diverse styles, to everyone more baroque, to have the perfect aspect. It is not a shame if they say: You, Baroque!

Will you have suitable assistants? Marcial, El Bonico del to, Enjuto Mojamuto, Riken Sproken, the Tridente Catacroker. The tragedy is in the atmosphere! The VHS tape will gonna jump through the window!

Muchachada Nui is a card game for three or four players of thirteen years or more. You will be able to play a game of thirty to sixty minutes, but maybe you’ll get caught for some hours...


En español:

Hay un hueco en la parrilla de programación de televisión española. Los directivos están muy preocupados y buscan un nuevo programa desesperadamente. Como joven productor debes preparar tu mejor programa televisivo de variedades y para ello cuentas con un gran elenco de personalidades. Contrata a las más rutilantes Celebrities, descubre al público las historias más increíbles y crea un espectacular Plató para cautivar a la audiencia. ¡Sólo el programa con más éxito acabará dentro de la programación!

En el juego de Muchachada Nui los jugadores, en el papel de surrealistas productores de televisión, pagan el caché de importantes Celebrities para ganar puntos de audiencia. El primer programa que llegue al máximo nivel de audiencia será proclamado vencedor.

Pero cuidado, las Celebrities que puedes contratar no sólo atraen a la audiencia. Todas tienen cualidades especiales... Samantha Fox y Sabrina Salerno atraen a Celebrities masculinas del programa de un oponente, Bud Spencer puede dejarlas fuera de combate de una tollina y no quieras saber que ocurre cuando Chuck Norris aparece en acción. ¡Freddy Krueger tiene pesadillas con Chuck Norris!

Por si fuera poco, añade a tu programa secciones especiales como Los Tertulianos, Los Tontiploster, Los Klamstein o La Consulta del Joven Rappel para llamar más la atención de los espectadores y decora tu Plató con diversos estilos, a cada cual más barroco, para tener la envoltura perfecta. Que no te avergüence que te digan ¡Barroco tú!

¿Seguro que contarás con ayudantes adecuados? Marcial, El Bonico del to, Enjuto Mojamuto, Riken Sproken, El Tridente Catacroker... ¡La tragedia se masca en el ambiente! ¡La cinta VHS está a punto de saltar por la ventana!

Muchachada Nui: El juego de mesa es un juego que se juega con cartas para tres o cuatro jugadores de trece años o más. Podréis echar una partida de treinta a sesenta minutos, aunque luego os liáis y os pueden dar las tantas.

Name: Panzer Ace Wittmann
Description: "Panzer Ace Wittmann" is a two-player tactical wargame simulates the "Battle of Bocage" in June 13rd, 1944. Players lead German SS Heavy Panzer Battalion 101 and British 7th Armor Division respectively to fight for Villers Bocage.
